New in version 0.60 of Rawr.Addon will be the ability to notice if an item is looted or linked in chat that is in your direct upgrades list.

If the addon spots an upgrade it will display a message and play a sound. Now I've coded it with four levels of possible sounds as follows...

Minor Upgrade, Upgrade, Big Upgrade, Massive Upgrade.

The options panel will allow you to set the percentage of upgrade and which sound to play. So for example if its a minor upgrade (eg: between 0 and 5% upgrade) it might play sound 1 which might be a "Meh maybe" style sound, for a big upgrade eg: between 10 & 20% upgrade it might play sound 3 which might be "hmm definitely have that" type sound, for a massive upgrade eg: over 20% it would play sound 4 which might be a OMG!!! NEEEEEED!! type sound. Now I want to include lots of possible sounds from in game.

So what I really need is suggestions (and ideally sound file names) of sounds I should include. Suggestions please?

I can see this being useful or also being incredibly annoying.
It should only happen when in a party/raid, and only when the chat is incomming via /y, /ra, /p or /w.
if you're going to play a sound each time somone links an epic in tradechat, you're going to be getting pissed off with it rather fast :p

you may want to make this configurable so people can adjust it to their looting system(s).

There's more than enough groups that do loot via normal rolls (with or without discussions befor eyou press 'need'), so it would need to intercept that also, and then it probably shouldn't notify on spam via /y /ra /p /w as well.

I wouldn't use different sounds, a single simple attention grabber is enough.

Indeed it is planned that it is fully configurable. At present it tracks loot when you open the looting window yourself. For messages it does NOT track the normal channels eg:general/trade/says/yells only tracking party, party leader, raid, raid leader, raid announce, and whisper. All of these will be on by default and I'll add options to enable/disable one or more of them. Depending on feedback I may add support for general channels but most definitely they would be off by default.

I won't however be disuaded from different sounds, as there is a radical difference between something that is a minor upgrade of 10-20 dps and something that's an upgrade of a few hundred or more dps. This also goes directly to the fun factor of the addon. Sure you can configure the same sound for every single type and thus have a single predicatable sound, or you can be the extrovert adding your own custom sounds to the addon via the support I've added for SharedMedia, and even record your OWN sounds for the addon to use. FUN!!!

On a personal level in own use I'll probably stick to a few default sounds that I like and nothing too unusual. However I strongly believe that addons like this should be open for users who are at the more extrovert end of the scale to be more creative. Hey its no real extra coding so why not. It doesn't create support issues as the support is for SharedMedia if there is an issue with custom sounds thats a SharedMedia issue NOT a Rawr issue, and those that customise their interface to that extent know about SharedMedia anyway.

Just to chime in, and since I can't program C worth a damn, chime'ing is all I can do around here. :)

for me, I would set it to a simple Ding sound as the Meh upgrade, 2 dings for a Larger upgrade, and 3 dings for a HUGE upgrade.  Perhaps I am not that imagintive but for me, that would be gentle enough so I dont jump out of my chair, and yet sure to get my attention when something NICE drops.
